revised_title: Storm Disturbance and Water Movements in the North Sea
tldr: The authors analyzed the water movements and meteorological conditions during a storm disturbance in the North Sea in January 1949. They found that the disturbance traveled counter-clockwise around the sea and had a close relation with the progression of the diurnal tide. The study provided insights into storm surges, their transmission through the Straits of Dover, and the effects on coastal areas.
